Description: Floor and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl; convex ring foot with scraped groove on resting surface; glazed black on interior, exterior (foot) and underside; reserved: junction of wall and foot, groove in resting surface; impressed decoration on interior consisting of circle of blurred rouletting (?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski compares this fragment to bowls with incurving rim (Sparkes, Agora XII nos. 830-833 figs. 8 and 22, pl. 33), dated 350 BC - 325BC.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 46 no. D6 pl. 19.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.034)
